properties.areaDesc: Acadia; Jefferson Davis; Evangeline; St. Landry; Avoyelles
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 2 at 7:58PM CST until January 3 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles LA
properties.description:
...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST FRIDAY...

.Two to four inches of rainfall, with isolated amounts over five
inches, has fallen across portions of Central and Southwest
Louisiana. This has produced isolated areas of flooding. An
additional one to two inches of rainfall will be possible this
evening through Friday morning. This additional rainfall may
produce additional flash flooding.

The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for portions of central Louisiana and
southwest Louisiana, including the following areas, in central
Louisiana, Avoyelles, Evangeline, and St. Landry. In southwest
Louisiana, Acadia and Jefferson Davis.

* Until 4 AM CST Friday

* Two to four inches of rainfall have fallen across the area. An
additional one to two inches of rainfall will be possible this
evening through Friday morning. This additional rainfall may
produce flash flooding.

* Some roads may be flooded or possibly closed.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST FRIDAY
